q.content: In Minecraft, if a player with no bad effect has only 3 hunger points left, when he eats 3 loaves of bread, can he restores the hunger to 20 points?

a.content:
A: To answer this question, we need to understand how hunger works in Minecraft. Eating bread restores hunger points, but it doesn't directly add points to the player's hunger bar. Instead, it replaces the existing hunger points with new ones.

When a player is at 3 hunger points and eats 3 loaves of bread, their current hunger points will be replenished first, making them 3 hunger points. However, since they have already eaten 3 loaves of bread, they won't consume any more bread after this.

To restore the hunger to 20 points, the player would need to consume more food items. In this case, consuming 17 more loaves of bread would be sufficient, as 17 + 3 = 20. This would restore the hunger to its initial value of 20 points.

So, the answer is that the player needs to eat 17 more loaves of bread to restore the hunger to 20 points.

q.content: In Minecraft, I am currently at height 30. Can I find diamonds at this level?

a.content:

q.content: In Minecraft, what happens when I hit a pig twice with a diamond sword?

a.content: A: When you hit a pig with a diamond sword twice, it will be killed and drop a pork chop.

q.content: In Minecraft, if I currently have 7 diamonds, 10 birch planks, and 1 diamond sword in my inventory, and I now make a diamond pickaxe, what remains in my inventory?

a.content: A: When you craft a diamond pickaxe using 7 diamonds, the 7 diamonds will be consumed and transformed into the pickaxe. You will no longer have the diamonds in your inventory. However, the 1 diamond sword you already have will remain in your inventory.
